title: Cavalcade
description: This 1933 Oscar winner as Best Picture is a film version of Noel Coward's 1929 play, which ran in London's West End for more than a year. The stage production was a gigantic spectacle with an enormous cast, though it focused mainly on 30 years in the lives of a well-do-English family facing two wars, class conflict and other assorted tragedies. Time has not treated it well, and it will principally interest film buff and historians. This is a mp4 transfer is from the Blu-Ray edition issued in 2012. The image is rather soft, not surprising as the film is more than 80 year old.
